entry.title: Large Film Starter Bundle
entry.summary:
Vendor: IKONART
Type:
Price: 164.40

Bundle and save 10%

Receive an automatic discount when you buy the Large Film Starter Bundle. If you are ready to start making larger stencils, this is the perfect bundle for you. Our 12"x18" stencil films are great for large chalkboard signs, larger T-shirt sizes, large wood signs, and so much more. The Starter Bundle includes an Extender Bar to raise up your light, 12"x18" stencil film, and 11"x17" printer film. Mix and match any combination of films. 

Large Film Starter Bundle Includes: 

  • (1) 23" Extender Bar
  • (1) 10-Sheet Pack of 12"x18" Ikonart Stencil Film OR Ikonart Textile Film
  • (1) 25-Sheet Pack of 11"x17" Ikonart Inkjet Film OR Ikonart Laser Film

entry.title: Ikonart Textile Film 12" x 18"
entry.summary:
Vendor: IKONART
Type:
Price: 115.00

These 12" x 18" sheets are perfect for larger signs, chalkboards, porch signs, etc.

Larger stencil films are designed to be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit, but the kit MUST be modified with the Extender Bar to raise the light up higher. You will also need to flip the light around and expose your film on a smooth, flat surface (pictured above).

Note: If you are looking for a less sticky stencil for glass, mirrors, ceramic, chalkboards, or other smooth surfaces, check out our Ikonart Stencil Film. Our original blue film was designed with a lighter adhesive for easier printing on smooth, flat surfaces. 

Ikonart Stencil Film - 12"x18" Size:

  • To be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit 
  • Must raise the light using the Extender Bar
  • Use with our 11"x17" Inkjet Printer Film or Laser Printer Film (you can also piece together multiple 8"x11" sheets)
  • Reusable, customizable, easy-to-use, repositionable
  • Perfect for fabric, textiles, wood and textured surfaces
  • Mesh Count: 120
  • Sheet Size: 12 in. x 18 in. (30.5 cm x 45.7 cm)
  • Available Pack Size: 10-Sheet
  • Made in the USA (Duluth, MN)
  • User Guide for original Ikonart Kit (with acrylic stand)
  • User Guide for Ikonart Kit 2.0 (with metal stand)
  • SDS for Ikonart Stencil Film available upon request

USING THE 12" X 18" STENCIL FILM

  1. ADJUST STAND: Swap out the regular 18” bar with the 23” Extender Bar. You must use the Extender Bar to raise the light. Flip the light around so the light is over a smooth, flat surface instead of over the base (see picture above). 
  2. EXPOSE FILM: Place your Ikonart Stencil Film on a smooth, flat surface with the textured side facing up. The longer side of the film should be parallel with the base of the stand (see picture above). Place artwork on top of the Stencil Film so you can read it. Top everything with the clear exposure sheet (included in the film pack) and rub down to ensure a good seal between the film positive and the stencil film. Turn on the exposure unit and expose for 1 minute and 40 seconds.
  3. WASHOUT FILM: Washout is exactly the same as the smaller 10”x12” Stencil Film. Do not washout in front of a bright window. Washout your stencil using warm water until all mesh areas are clear of the emulsion.
  4. POST-EXPOSE FILM: DO NOT SKIP THIS STEP. When your imaged stencil is completely dry, post-expose under the light for a minimum of 5 minutes. Post-exposing increases the durability when reusing your stencils. A clear sheet is not needed for post-exposure. Optional: flip the film over halfway through post-exposure so you are post-exposing from both sides of the film (front and back). 

CARING FOR YOUR STENCILS

Ikonart Stencil Film is light sensitive and should remain in the packaging it comes in until you are ready to expose it. The film must stay out of the sunlight and bright lights before exposure and during washout. Keep unused stencil film in the black bag when not in use.

The unexposed film has a shelf life of at least one year from the date of manufacture if stored and handled properly. For storage of the Ikonart Stencil Film, before it is exposed, we recommend storing it in a cool, dry place. Temperatures should not be below freezing or above 85°F. After the film is exposed, your finished stencils should be stored flat in a dry area.

Do not soak your stencils in water for extended periods of time. Do not use any chemicals (such as cleaning wipes) when washing paint off your stencils, as these chemicals can break down the emulsion and adhesive. 

INCREASE STICKINESS

If you over-washed your stencils and they don’t seem sticky enough, try one of these tips to make them stickier.

  1. Use a damp paper towel or fine mister to lightly moisten the adhesive side.
  2. Huff on (exhale hot air) the adhesive side of the stencil before applying to your surface
  3. Use a small handheld steamer to lightly steam the adhesive side.
  4. Rub-down the stencil really well before you apply your paint/paste/link to activate the adhesive.
  5. Use a spray adhesive to make the stencils stickier.

QUICK START GUIDE

See the Ikonart Quick Start Guide for full instructions. The guide is also included in the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit.

SAFETY INFORMATION

Our stencil films are made in the USA at our headquarters in Duluth, Minnesota. They have been independently tested by InfoTox International to ensure they are safe when used as directed. They meet all health requirements of the Labeling of Hazardous Art Materials Act (LHAMA) and conform to ASTM D-4236.

entry.title: Ikonart Stencil Film 12" x 18"
entry.summary:
Vendor: IKONART
Type:
Price: 115.00

These 12" x 18" sheets are perfect for larger signs, chalkboards, porch signs, etc.

Larger stencil films are designed to be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit, but the kit MUST be modified with the Extender Bar to raise the light up higher. You will also need to flip the light around and expose your film on a smooth, flat surface (pictured above).

Note: Looking for stickier stencils for shirts, tea towels, pillow covers, fabric, textiles, wood, or other textured surfaces, check out our Ikonart Textile Film. This purple film was specifically designed for DIY screen printing on textiles, but the more aggressive adhesive makes it the perfect choice for wood projects as well.  

Ikonart Stencil Film - 12"x18" Size:

  • To be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit 
  • Must raise the light using the Extender Bar
  • Use with our 11"x17" Inkjet Printer Film or Laser Printer Film (you can also piece together multiple 8"x11" sheets)
  • Reusable, customizable, easy-to-use, repositionable
  • Perfect for glass, plastic, chalkboard and smooth surfaces
  • Mesh Count: 120
  • Sheet Size: 12 in. x 18 in. (30.5 cm x 45.7 cm)
  • Available Pack Size: 10-Sheet
  • Made in the USA (Duluth, MN)
  • User Guide for original Ikonart Kit (with acrylic stand)
  • User Guide for Ikonart Kit 2.0 (with metal stand)
  • SDS for Ikonart Stencil Film available upon request

USING THE 12" X 18" STENCIL FILM

  1. ADJUST STAND: Swap out the regular 18” bar with the 23” Extender Bar. You must use the Extender Bar to raise the light. Flip the light around so the light is over a smooth, flat surface instead of over the base (see picture above). 
  2. EXPOSE FILM: Place your Ikonart Stencil Film on a smooth, flat surface with the textured side facing up. The longer side of the film should be parallel with the base of the stand (see picture above). Place artwork on top of the Stencil Film so you can read it. Top everything with the clear exposure sheet (included in the film pack) and rub down to ensure a good seal between the film positive and the stencil film. Turn on the exposure unit and expose for 1 minute and 40 seconds.
  3. WASHOUT FILM: Washout is exactly the same as the smaller 10”x12” Stencil Film. Do not washout in front of a bright window. Washout your stencil using warm water until all mesh areas are clear of the emulsion.
  4. POST-EXPOSE FILM: DO NOT SKIP THIS STEP. When your imaged stencil is completely dry, post-expose under the light for a minimum of 5 minutes. Post-exposing increases the durability when reusing your stencils. A clear sheet is not needed for post-exposure. Optional: flip the film over halfway through post-exposure so you are post-exposing from both sides of the film (front and back). 

CARING FOR YOUR STENCILS

Ikonart Stencil Film is light sensitive and should remain in the packaging it comes in until you are ready to expose it. The film must stay out of the sunlight and bright lights before exposure and during washout. Keep unused stencil film in the black bag when not in use.

The unexposed film has a shelf life of at least one year from the date of manufacture if stored and handled properly. For storage of the Ikonart Stencil Film, before it is exposed, we recommend storing it in a cool, dry place. Temperatures should not be below freezing or above 85°F. After the film is exposed, your finished stencils should be stored flat in a dry area.

Do not soak your stencils in water for extended periods of time. Do not use any chemicals (such as cleaning wipes) when washing paint off your stencils, as these chemicals can break down the emulsion and adhesive.

If you over-washed your stencils and they don’t seem sticky enough, try one of these tips to make them stickier.

  1. Use a damp paper towel or fine mister to lightly moisten the adhesive side.
  2. Huff on (exhale hot air) the adhesive side of the stencil before applying to your surface
  3. Use a small handheld steamer to lightly steam the adhesive side.
  4. Rub-down the stencil really well before you apply your paint/paste/link to activate the adhesive.
  5. Use a spray adhesive to make the stencils stickier.

QUICK START GUIDE

See the Ikonart Quick Start Guide for full instructions. The guide is also included in the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit.

SAFETY INFORMATION

Our stencil films are made in the USA at our headquarters in Duluth, Minnesota. They have been independently tested by InfoTox International to ensure they are safe when used as directed. They meet all health requirements of the Labeling of Hazardous Art Materials Act (LHAMA) and conform to ASTM D-4236.

entry.title: Extender Bar for 12"X18" Film
entry.summary:
Vendor: Ikonart
Type:
Price: 14.50

Larger stencil films are designed to be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit, but the kit MUST be modified with this Extender Bar to raise the light up higher. This Extender Bar should be used with the 12"x18" Ikonart Textile Film and the 12"x18" Ikonart Stencil Film.

SETUP

This Extender Bar is compatible with the original acrylic Ikonart Exposure Stand or the new metal Ikonart Exposure Stand. Just remove the original shorter bar and replace with this Extender Bar in order to raise the light. You will need to flip the light around so it is not over the base when exposing the large film sheets. 

EXPOSURE

Flip the light around so it is facing away from the base. Place your film on a smooth, flat surface so the long edge of your film is parallel with the base of the stand. See pictures above for reference. Expose your film for 1 minute and 40 seconds when using this Extender Bar. Note: You can expose the 10"x12" or 12"x18" sheets with this Extender Bar on your exposure stand. 

After you washout and dry your film, post-expose for 5-6 minutes. Optional: flip the film over halfway through post-exposure so you are post-exposing from both sides of the film (front and back).

entry.title: Ikonart Textile Film 10" x 12"
entry.summary:
Vendor: IKONART
Type:
Price: 40.00 - 148.00 (3 variants)

Ikonart Smart Screen Stencils are the fastest, smartest, and easiest way to create custom stencils at home. This film is just like our original blue stencil film, but stickier and slightly more rigid which makes it the perfect film for printing on fabric, wood, and other textured or difficult surfaces. 

Create customized stencils for your t-shirts and other textile printing in three simple steps!

  1. PRINT - Design artwork and print onto Inkjet Film or Laser Film.
  2. EXPOSE - Expose printed image onto the IKONART Stencil Film using the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit. Exposure time is 35 seconds using the Ikonart light stand. Please note that exposure times will vary if you use a different exposure light. We highly recommend using our Ikonart exposure unit for the best results. 
  3. RINSE - Rinse film to reveal your stencil!

After your stencil dries, you are ready to start using your stencil. The possibilities are endless! 

NOTE ON POST-EXPOSURE

Post-exposing our Ikonart Textile Film will increase the durability when reusing your stencils. After you washout and dry your stencil for the first time, just pop it back under the exposure light for a minimum of 2 minutes (we recommend 2-3 minutes; you cannot over post-expose the film). This step is absolutely necessary to increase the durability when washing and re-washing your stencil for multiple uses.

NOTE: When ordering your stencil film, don't forget to also order either Inkjet Printer Film or Laser Printer Film so you can make your stencils!

IKONART Smart Screen Stencils:

  • To be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit 
  • Reusable
  • Customizable
  • Easy-to-use
  • Repositionable
  • Mesh count: 120
  • Sheet Size: 10 in. x 12 in. (25.4 cm x 30.5 cm)
  • Available Pack Size: 5-Sheet, 10-Sheet or 25-Sheet
  • Made in the USA (Duluth, MN)
  • User Guide

entry.title: Ikonart Stencil Film 10" x 12"
entry.summary:
Vendor: IKONART
Type:
Price: 40.00 - 148.00 (3 variants)

The original Ikonart Stencil Film is designed to be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit to create custom, reusable silkscreen stencils. Blue stencils are perfect for glass, mirrors, ceramic, chalkboards, and all smooth, flat surfaces. The adhesive is gentle enough so the stencils won't distort when you are removing them from these types of smooth surfaces. 

Ikonart Smart Screen Stencils are the fastest, smartest, and easiest way to create custom stencils at home. Create customized stencils in three simple steps!

  1. PRINT - Design artwork and print onto Inkjet Film or Laser Film.
  2. EXPOSE - Expose printed image onto the Ikonart Stencil Film using the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit. Exposure time is 35 seconds using the Ikonart light stand. Please note that exposure times will vary if you use a different exposure light. We highly recommend using our Ikonart exposure unit for the best results. 
  3. RINSE - Rinse film to reveal your stencil!

After your stencil dries, you are ready to start using your stencil. The possibilities are endless! 

Our original Ikonart Stencil Film is designed to be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit to create custom, reusable silkscreen stencils. These blue stencils are perfect for glass, mirrors, ceramic, chalkboards and other smooth, flat surfaces. The adhesive is gentle enough so the stencils won't distort when you are removing them from these types of smooth surfaces. 

If you are looking for stickier stencils for shirts, tea towels, pillow covers, fabric, textiles, wood, or other textured surfaces, check out our Ikonart Textile Film. This new purple film was specifically designed for DIY screen printing on textiles, but the more aggressive adhesive makes it the perfect choice for wood projects as well. 

NOTE ON POST-EXPOSURE

Post-exposing our Ikonart Stencil Film will increase the durability when reusing your stencils! After you washout and dry your stencil for the first time, just pop it back under the exposure light for a minimum of 2 minutes (we recommend 2-3 minutes; you cannot over post-expose the film). This step is absolutely necessary to increase the durability when washing and re-washing your stencil for multiple uses. 2-3 minutes will give you more durability for a wide variety of washout conditions.

NOTE: When ordering your stencil film, don't forget to also order either Inkjet Printer Film or Laser Printer Film so you can make your stencils!

Ikonart Smart Screen Stencils:

  • To be used with the Ikonart Custom Stencil Kit 
  • Reusable
  • Customizable
  • Easy-to-use
  • Repositionable
  • Mesh count: 120
  • Sheet Size: 10 in. x 12 in. (25.4 cm x 30.5 cm)
  • Available Pack Size: 5-Sheet, 10-Sheet or 25-Sheet
  • Made in the USA (Duluth, MN)
  • User Guide
